reqsimile.simcalc
Class Tokens

java.lang.Object
  reqsimile.simcalc.Tokens
public class Tokens
extends java.lang.Object

Tokens temporarily holds all the tokens/words used in the requirements sets. It is used in the preprocessing step to rebuild the token table, which is stored in an external database table.

Since:
1.4.2
Author:
Johan Natt och Dag

Constructor Detail

Tokens

public Tokens()
Method Detail

fetch

public boolean fetch()
Fetches tokens from the database.

The database currently used is the same as the one specified by requirements set A. This should be changed to specify any optional database.

Returns:
True on success, false otherwise

store

public void store()
Stores all tokens in the database. Only tokens in memory are stored and to preserve the tokens in the database they must first be fetched (fetch()).

The database currently used is the same as the one specified by requirements set A. This should be changed to specify any optional database.

add

public int add(java.lang.String token)
Adds a token to the set of tokens.

Parameters:
token -
Returns:
The unique key assigned to the token

numberAdded

public int numberAdded()
Returns the number of tokens added (number of calls to add(java.lang.String)). This is primarily used to count the additional number of tokens in a preprocessed requirements set, compared to those tokens already found in previous requirements set(s).

Returns:
int The number of tokens added

clearAddedCount

public void clearAddedCount()
Clears the counter for the number of added tokens.
